thread.title: Miamisburg hotel plans renovations

author: Tristan Navera
title: Miamisburg hotel plans renovations
text:
A hotel in Miamisburg plans renovations. A hotel in Miamisburg plans renovations. The DoubleTree Guest Suites at 300 Prestige Place is preparing for a project to renovate its conference room spaces, according to county documents. The 71,000-square-foot hotel has 137 rooms and five meeting rooms, and a staff of 48, according to the 2014 DBJ Book of Lists. Hotel officials could not comment on the project. The hotel, which is under new ownership of Dublin-based iHospitality Hotel Group, expects the project to cost about $328,500 and could entail internal renovations and additions to the conference spaces, according to county documents. The local hotel industry has been heating up with major renovations and updates at several area hotels, and several new hotels proposed, including a new hotel on Miller Lane and another proposed at Cornerstone of Centerville. DoubleTree is the 14th largest hotel in the Dayton area. It sits in an area near the Dayton Mall where several other construction projects are taking place, including Kettering Health Network's headquarters building down the road. The hotel is working with Dale Keeran of Springboro-based McCall Sharp Architecture, as well as Tom Schnipper of Schnipper Construction Co. out of Botkins.
